title: NASA chief classifies Starliner flight as "Type A" mishap, says agency made mistakes
summary: "The most troubling failure revealed by this investigation is not hardware."

title: Starliner investigation identifies flawed NASA decision making
summary:
NASA has classified the flawed Starliner crewed test flight in 2024 as its most serious level of mishap, with the agency’s leadership citing shortfalls in how officials oversaw the program.
The post Starliner investigation identifies flawed NASA decision making appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Investigates How People Respond to Air Taxi Noise
summary: New kinds of aircraft taking to the skies could mean unfamiliar sounds overhead — and where you’re hearing them might matter, according to new NASA research. NASA aeronautics has worked for years to enable new air transportation options for people and goods, and to find ways to make sure they can be safely and effectively […]

title: NASA Releases Report on Starliner Crewed Flight Test Investigation
summary: At a news conference on Thursday, NASA released a report of findings from the Program Investigation Team examining the Boeing CST-100 Starliner Crewed Flight Test as part of the agency’s Commercial Crew Program.   “The Boeing Starliner spacecraft has faced challenges throughout its uncrewed and most recent crewed missions. While Boeing built Starliner, NASA accepted it and launched two astronauts to space. […]

title: NASA to Provide Starliner Crew Flight Test Review Findings Today
summary: During a news conference at 2 p.m. EST on Thursday NASA will discuss the findings of investigations into the 2024 crewed test flight of Boeing Starliner to the International Space Station. The news conference will stream live on NASA’s YouTube channel. An instant replay will be available online. NASA participants include: To ask questions during […]

title: Award-Winning NASA Camera Revolutionizes How We See the Invisible
summary: Imagine trying to photograph wind. That’s similar to what NASA engineers dealt with during a recent effort to study how air moves around planes, rockets, and other kinds of aerospace vehicles. Air is invisible, but our understanding of how it flows is crucial for building better, safer aircraft. For 80 years, researchers used a technique […]

title: Sophie Adenot exercising on the CEVIS bike
Crystals Grown in Space
summary: This June 5, 2024, image shows lysozyme crystals aboard the International Space Station. Lysozyme is a protein found in bodily fluids like tears, saliva, and milk, and is used as a control compound to demonstrate well-formed crystals. Lysozyme plays a vital role in innate immunity, protecting against bacteria, viruses, and fungi. The crystals were grown with […]

title: Map the Earth’s Magnetic Shield with the Space Umbrella Project
